Position: Human Resources Business Partner
Responsible for aligning business objectives strategy to HC strategy with employees and management, assessing and anticipating in HC-related needs.
Recommend and advise on the Human Capital-related communications to ensure meeting the targeted change management and communication plans.
Follow up on major Human Capital-related assignments to support timely completion, while providing the team with the needful support.
Keep abreast on the updates of the Human Capital updates; policies, strategies, reviews, projects, and initiatives for the required communication or action.
Draft and Review corporate policies to ensure meeting specific-business requirements to enable performance by people and functions.
Manage and resolve complex HC issues with the business, seeking the counsel of other HC resources as required. Conduct effective, thorough and objective investigations.
Facilitate and provide guidance and input on all aspects of HC strategy, programs, policies and processes, including: organizational re-structuring; job evaluation; workforce planning; performance management; recruitment, selection and on-boarding; succession planning; learning & development; redeployment plans; secondment; reward management; employee engagement; etc.
Participate in the business reviews to provide with the needful insights and reports regarding the Human Capital processes, updates, and pertain information to support the decision making.
Concur with the Human Capital Management and Organization Design the course of actions related to the business plans and updates to ensure proper reflection on the Human Capital Processes in the company
Dec 2007 to Oct 2019 Abu Dhabi Autonomous Systems Investments- Subsidiary of Tawazun
Position: Human Resources Manager
Responsibilities:
responsible for the smooth and profitable operation of human resources department by supervise and provide consultation to management on strategic staffing plans including recruitment and selection, compensation, benefits, training and development, budget, and labour relations.
Responsible for developing a culture that enables employees to perform in accordance to company’s objectives.
Lead performance management, talent assessment, and effective labour relationships, including negotiating and administering labour agreements.
Supervises HR staff and reports to the chief executive officer on issues regarding implementation of policies and procedures, safety of the workforce, recruiting and hiring high-performing employees, and labour, legislative and other human resources issues.
Development and implementation of development programs, employee orientation and training programs, benefits plan, policies and guidelines, database management procedures, equal opportunity employment programs, and to support in employee records and documentation policies.
Evaluating effectiveness through compiling and analysing data by preparing and distributing various reports on HR metrics to ensure needs are met.
Provide senior management and others with various types of employee reports including attrition, absence, compensation, annual leave, overtime costs and headcount
Ensuring compliance with federal and labour laws and industry when related to legal implications of employment legalization and HR issues related to discipline and employee grievances.
Planning and overseeing the HR department budget.
Manage of all new employees and contract staff.
Manage all redundancy situations including calculations, financial guidance and communications to affected employees.
Management of risk assessments, audits and revisions of policy and procedures. Engage with consultants on an ad hoc basis.
Design and implementation of a company-wide performance management system that is linked to the core vision and objectives of the business. Provision of on-going consultation to management on performance related issues.
Managing monthly payroll process and assure timely implementation.
Keep up to date with current HR/Labour legislation and ensure this is updated in the company's Human Resource policies.
July to Dec National Health Insurance Company
Position: HR Administrator
Responsibilities:
Respond to employees’ inquiries regarding procedures, programs and personal information.
Administer all leaves and reports, all medical insurance, pre payroll administration.
COMMENT
Experienced human resource manager with expertise in industrial relations as well as overall management skills including staff management & project leadership.
